channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Cuomo, Staunch Supporter of Israel, Says ‘Horrific’ Gaza War Must End
item.description: The remarks were a departure for former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who trails Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani in the New York City mayor’s race.

item.title: JD Vance hosts 'The Charlie Kirk Show,' paying tribute with top White House officials
item.description: The broadcast was a striking reminder of Kirk's influence, both as a leader in the young conservative space and a behind-the-scenes political player w...

item.title: Football Is Coming to Saudi Arabia, Where Soccer Is King
item.description: Saudi Arabia will host a flag football tournament featuring N.F.L. stars in the spring, in a mutually beneficial sports expansion.

item.title: Eddie Giacomin, Rangers’ Goalie and Fan Favorite, Dies at 86
item.description: A Hall of Famer, he led the N.H.L. in shutouts and single-season victories three times and was stunned when the Rangers let him go in his 10th season.

item.title: Why Trump wants companies to report earnings less frequently
item.description: President Trump would like companies to report their earnings less frequently. Executives have long called for that -- but some financial experts worr...

item.title: Washington Post Columnist Says She Was Fired for Posts After Charlie Kirk Shooting
item.description: Karen Attiah said she was fired for “speaking out against political violence” and America’s apathy toward guns.

item.title: Telling stories of gun violence deaths almost cost this reporter his life
item.description: Trymaine Lee spent years reporting on the deaths of men who look just like him. His new memoir, A Thousand Ways to Die, chronicles the impact of gun v...

item.title: Who is Fed nominee Stephen Miran, and why is he so controversial?
item.description: Stephen Miran, who has served in both Trump administrations, said he will not resign from the White House if confirmed to the Federal Reserve Board, f...

item.title: Sotheby’s Lands a Leonard Lauder Art Collection Worth More Than $400 Million
item.description: The collector’s trove of 55 works, including Klimt, Matisse and Munch, will be auctioned in November.

item.title: 5 new members added to CDC vaccine advisory panel ahead of key meeting
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. picks more new vaccine advisers to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, days before a two-day meetin...

item.title: Suspect in Madeleine McCann Disappearance Refuses Interview With UK Police
item.description: Christian Brückner, the main suspect in the 2007 case, rejected an interview request ahead of his release this week from a German prison for a separat...

item.title: Venezuela’s President Maduro Denounces U.S. Boat Attack, as Trump Announces Another
item.description: The Venezuela leader, Nicolás Maduro, claimed that the Trump administration was trying to start a war in the Caribbean.

item.title: Trump World’s Deals With the U.A.E.
item.description: We dug deeper into lucrative transactions involving the Trump family’s cryptocurrency firm and the United Arab Emirates.

item.title: Young People Suing Trump Over Climate Have Their Day in Federal Court
item.description: They claim Trump’s executive orders are unconstitutional. The government says their lawsuit should be thrown out. The two sides are set to clash this ...

item.title: Angered by Israel’s Attack in Qatar, Arab Leaders Meet to Weigh Response
item.description: Some Arab officials are pushing for tangible, but not military, action against Israel, and Egypt’s president said the Israeli strike threatened diplom...
